text: The 1996–97 Czech First League was the fourth season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. The season saw a Czech league attendance record for a single match, as 44,120 watched the game between Boby Brno and Slavia Prague. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== ==Top goalscorer== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Horst Siegl |align="left"|Sparta Prague |19 |- !2 |align="left"| Karel Vácha |align="left"|Slavia Prague |14 |- !rowspan="2"|3 |align="left"| Radek Drulák |align="left"|Petra Drnovice |rowspan="2"|13 |- |align="left"| Alois Grussmann |align="left"|Kaučuk Opava |- !5 |align="left"| Vratislav Lokvenc |align="left"|Sparta Prague |12 |- !rowspan="4"|6 |align="left"| Jozef Majoroš |align="left"|Petra Drnovice |rowspan="4"|11 |- |align="left"| Jan Saidl |align="left"|České Budějovice |- |align="left"| Ladislav Fujdiar |align="left"|České Budějovice |- |align="left"| Martin Rozhon |align="left"|Kaučuk Opava / Petra Drnovice |} ==See also== * 1996–97 Czech Cup * 1996–97 Czech 2. title: 1996–97 Czech First League
